intro: Quercus chainolepis, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for wildlife. Quercus chainolepis typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
